definitions.definition: A mass of things heaped together; a heap .
( informal ) A group or list of related items up for consideration, especially in some kind of selection process.
examples: When we were looking for a new housemate, we put the nice woman on the "maybe" pile , and the annoying guy on the "no" pile

definitions.definition: A mass formed in layers.
A funeral pile; a pyre .
( slang ) A large amount of money .
examples: He made a pile from that invention of his.

definitions.definition: A large building, or mass of buildings.
A bundle of pieces of wrought iron to be worked over into bars or other shapes by rolling or hammering at a welding heat; a fagot .

A vertical series of alternate disks of two dissimilar metals (especially copper and zinc), laid up with disks of cloth or paper moistened with acid water between them, for producing a current of electricity; a voltaic pile, or galvanic pile.
( architecture , civil engineering ) A beam , pole , or pillar , driven completely into the ground, usually as one of a group that constitutes a foundation .
An atomic pile ; an early form of nuclear reactor .
( obsolete ) The reverse (or tails) of a coin.
A list or league

main_definition: A mass of things heaped together; a heap .
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) A group or list of related items up for consideration, especially in some kind of selection process.
( slang ) A large amount of money .
A large building, or mass of buildings.
A bundle of pieces of wrought iron to be worked over into bars or other shapes by rolling or hammering at a welding heat; a fagot .

A vertical series of alternate disks of two dissimilar metals (especially copper and zinc), laid up with disks of cloth or paper moistened with acid water between them, for producing a current of electricity; a voltaic pile, or galvanic pile.
( architecture , civil engineering ) A beam , pole , or pillar , driven completely into the ground, usually as one of a group that constitutes a foundation .
An atomic pile ; an early form of nuclear reactor .
( obsolete ) The reverse (or tails) of a coin.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) A dart ; an arrow .
The head of an arrow or spear .
A large stake , or piece of pointed timber , steel etc., driven into the earth or sea-bed for the support of a building, a pier , or other superstructure , or to form a cofferdam , etc.
( heraldry ) One of the ordinaries or subordinaries having the form of a wedge , usually placed palewise , with the broadest end uppermost.

secondary_definitions: The head of an arrow or spear .
A large stake , or piece of pointed timber , steel etc., driven into the earth or sea-bed for the support of a building, a pier , or other superstructure , or to form a cofferdam , etc.
( heraldry ) One of the ordinaries or subordinaries having the form of a wedge , usually placed palewise , with the broadest end uppermost.

definitions.definition: ( usually in the plural ) A hemorrhoid .

main_definition: ( usually in the plural ) A hemorrhoid .

definitions.definition: Hair , especially when very fine or short; the fine underfur of certain animals. (Formerly countable, now treated as a collective singular.)
The raised hairs, loops or strands of a fabric ; the nap of a cloth.

main_definition: Hair , especially when very fine or short; the fine underfur of certain animals. (Formerly countable, now treated as a collective singular.)
secondary_definitions: The raised hairs, loops or strands of a fabric ; the nap of a cloth.

definitions.definition: A battery ( simple device for converting chemical potential energy into usable electricity ) .

subdefinitions.definition: A battery consisting of repeated units of alternating types of metal; voltaic pile .

main_definition: ( historical , electrochemistry ) A battery ( simple device for converting chemical potential energy into usable electricity ) .
